poem:
Snow Leopard's Gaze

In the high silence of Tibet,  
a shadow moves, ancient as rock.  
We witness in its reflective eyes  
the tension of unending chase—  
progress edges on tradition's fur,  
draped over this destined land.  
Cinema can't capture the truth,  
only echoes of spirit and snow,  
where legends pace serenely.
